description:
Financial assistance for people with disabilities as per Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016.  Categories of Disabilities:

1. Locomotor disability (including leprosy cured person, cerebral palsy, dwarfism, muscular dystrophy, acid attack victims)
2. Visual impairment (blindness, low-vision)
3. Hearing impairment (deaf, hard of hearing)
4. Speech and language disability
5. Intellectual disability (specific learning disabilities, autism spectrum disorder)
6. Mental illness
7. Disability caused due to chronic neurological conditions (multiple sclerosis, parkinson's disease)
8. Blood disorder (haemophilia, thalassemia, sickle cell disease)
9. Multiple Disabilities (more than one of the above specified disabilities) including deaf blindness
10. Any other category as may be notified by the Central Government
funding_pattern: Up to 300 to 1000 rupees as per disability category.
title: Financial Assistance for Disabilities

description: The Central Sector Scheme ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’ has been launched to revamp extension services using electronic media (Doordarshan and All India Radio) for technology and information transfer to farmers. The scheme utilizes the existing infrastructure of Doordarshan and All India Radio to educate farmers on modern technologies and research in agriculture and allied areas. A 30-minute program is telecast 5-6 days a week on Doordarshan's national, regional, and high/low power transmitters. All India Radio's 96 rural FM stations broadcast a 30-minute program 6 days a week.  The Department of Agriculture & Cooperation also launched a ‘Focused Advertisement Campaign’ to raise awareness of assistance available under various schemes through short audio and video spots on AIR, DD, and private channels.
title: Central Sector Scheme for ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’
documents: You tube Link for krishidarshan Programmes
List of Narrowcasting & Regional Doordarshan Kendras and FM Kisan Vani Stations under the Schemes

description: Market information is needed by farmers in planning production and marketing, and equally needed by other market participants in arriving at optimal trading decisions. The existence and dissemination of complete and accurate marketing information is the key to achieve both operational and pricing efficiency in the marketing system. Advancement in Information and Communication Technology (ICT) has made the world a smaller place and a larger market at one go. To fully utilize the new emerging trade opportunities for the benefit of farming community, there is a felt need to establish an ICT based 'Agricultural Marketing Information Network' in the country.
title: MARKETING RESEARCH AND INFORMATION NETWORK

title: AMIGS SCHEME

description: The Central Sector Scheme ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’ has been launched to revamp extension services using electronic media (Doordarshan and All India Radio) for technology transfer to farmers. It leverages TV and Radio's wide reach at low cost. Existing infrastructure is utilized to educate farmers on modern agricultural technologies. A 30-minute program airs 5-6 days/week on National, 18 Regional Kendras, and 180 Doordarshan Transmitters. 96 Rural FM stations broadcast 30-minute programs 6 days/week.  DAC produces films for Doordarshan showcasing success stories and innovations. A focused ad campaign creates awareness of assistance schemes through 30-60 second audio/video spots on AIR, DD, and private channels.
title: Central Sector Scheme for ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’
documents: You tube Link for krishidarshan Programmes
List of Narrowcasting & Regional Doordarshan Kendras and FM Kisan Vani Stations under the Schemes

description: AGMARKNET is a Central Sector Scheme launched by the Ministry of Agriculture in March 2000 to create a nationwide information network for agricultural marketing. It aims to disseminate market information to farmers and other stakeholders for better decision-making in production and marketing. The scheme uses ICT to connect agricultural produce markets, State Agricultural Marketing Boards, and Directorates across the country. It provides information on prices, market trends, arrivals, dispatches, and other relevant data through a web portal and other means.  The scheme also aims to improve market efficiency through training and extension activities, and by promoting nationally and internationally acceptable standards of grading, packaging, and quality certification.
title: AGMARKNET (Agricultural Marketing Information Network)

description: The Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure Grading and Standardization (AMIGS) scheme, as of 31-03-2013, has sanctioned a total of 8752 projects and released a total subsidy of Rs. 797.23 crores since its inception.  The progress report details the year-wise and plan-wise status of projects sanctioned and the financial status of subsidy released through various agencies like NABARD, NCDC, and State Agencies. States like Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan, Chattisgarh, Himachal Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Gujarat, Sikkim, Karnataka, Assam, Nagaland, West Bengal, and Bihar have benefitted from the scheme. However, states like Daman and Diu, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Lakshadweep, Arunachal Pradesh, Chandigarh, Manipur, Tripura, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Goa, Jharkhand, Mizoram & Uttarakhand are also permitted, though no projects have been sanctioned there yet. States / UTs not permitted are Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, J & K, Meghalaya, and Puducherry.
funding_pattern: Subsidy through NABARD, NCDC, and State Agencies.
title: AMIGS Scheme Progress Report
